name: St. Lullus

locations.description: Archbishop of Mainz, successor to St. Boniface

summary: Lullus was an English monk who became the Archbishop of Mainz and successor to St. Boniface. He was a disciple of Boniface and continued his missionary work in Germany. He founded the Abbey of Hersfeld and played an important role in organizing the Church in Germany. He was a key figure in the Christianization of the Saxons and the consolidation of the Frankish Church.
